topics.question: Let's talk about where you live

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Do you live in a house or a flat?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: Well, I live in a flat in the city centre. Actually, I've been living there for about three years now.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Can you describe the place where you live?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: To be honest, it's quite spacious for a city flat. It has two bedrooms, a modern kitchen, and a lovely balcony overlooking the park. What I really like is that it gets a lot of natural light.

discourse: What I really like is that

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: How long have you lived there?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: As I mentioned, I've been there for about three years. I moved in right after I started my current job, so it's been my home for quite a while now.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What do you like about living there?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I'd say the location is fantastic. I'm really close to public transport, shops, and cafés. On top of that, the neighbourhood is very vibrant but still peaceful at night.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What is your favourite room? Why?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: Without a doubt, my favourite room is the living room. The main reason is that it's where I relax after work. I've got a comfortable sofa, and the large windows make it feel really airy and bright.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Where are you from?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I'm originally from a small coastal town in the south of Portugal. It's called Lagos. It's quite a picturesque place with beautiful beaches.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What do you like about your hometown?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: Well, I absolutely love the relaxed atmosphere. People are very friendly and welcoming. Plus, the weather is amazing – we have sunshine almost year-round.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What do you not like about it?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: To be frank, the main downside is the lack of job opportunities. It's very tourism-dependent, so career options are quite limited. That's actually why I moved to the city.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: How important is your hometown to you?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: It's incredibly important to me. I mean, it's where I grew up and where my family still lives. It shaped who I am today, so I'll always feel a deep connection to it.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Do you think you will live there in the future?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I'd love to go back one day, perhaps when I retire. However, for now, I need to stay in the city for work. Maybe I'll find a way to have the best of both worlds – a place in the city and one in my hometown.

topics.question: Let's talk about your work or studies

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Do you work or are you a student?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I'm currently working. I've been in the same company for the past two years now.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What do you do?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I work as a marketing coordinator for a tech startup. Basically, I handle social media campaigns, content creation, and analyse customer engagement data.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Why did you choose that job?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: Well, I've always been interested in digital marketing and technology. The company offered me a great opportunity to combine both interests. On top of that, the startup environment is fast-paced and innovative, which I find really exciting.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What do you like about your job?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I'd say the best part is the creative freedom I have. I can experiment with new ideas and see immediate results. What's more, my colleagues are brilliant and very supportive.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Is there anything you would like to change?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: To be honest, the workload can be quite overwhelming at times. If I could change something, I'd like more work-life balance. Perhaps having flexible working hours would help.

topics.question: Let's talk about your hobbies and free time

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What do you like doing in your free time?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: Well, I'm really into photography. I love going out with my camera and capturing interesting moments. I also enjoy reading, especially historical fiction.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: How much time do you have to relax?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: To be frank, not as much as I'd like. During the week, I'm quite busy with work, so I only have a couple of hours in the evening. However, weekends are when I can really unwind.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: How do you usually relax?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I'd say my go-to way to relax is going for a walk in nature. It helps me clear my mind. Alternatively, I like watching documentaries or listening to podcasts while doing some light stretching.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Do you think modern life gives us enough time to relax?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I don't think so, honestly. Modern life is incredibly fast-paced and demanding. We're constantly connected through technology, which makes it hard to switch off. I believe people need to make a conscious effort to prioritise relaxation.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Do you like travelling?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: Absolutely! I'm passionate about travelling. I find it incredibly enriching to experience different cultures and meet new people. It really broadens your perspective.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: How often do you travel?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: Well, I try to travel at least twice a year. Usually, I take one longer trip during the summer and a shorter city break in winter. Of course, it depends on my work schedule and budget.

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: Where did you go on your last trip?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: My last trip was to Barcelona. I went there last autumn for a long weekend. I was blown away by the architecture, especially Gaudí's work. The food was also fantastic – I tried so many delicious tapas!

dialogue.speaker: interlocutor
dialogue.text: What kind of places do you prefer to visit?

dialogue.speaker: candidate
dialogue.text: I'd say I prefer places with a rich cultural heritage and history. I'm drawn to cities with stunning architecture and vibrant local markets. That said, I also appreciate natural landscapes – mountains, beaches, that sort of thing.
